svg.text: AgnosticV Catalog Validator Workflow
INPUTS: What the Skill Asks For
• Catalog path (auto-detected from current directory or asked)
• Validation scope (Quick, Standard, or Full)
• AgnosticV repository path (for UUID collision checks)
PROCESS: What the Skill Does
1. Validates file structure (required: common.yaml, recommended: description.adoc)
2. Checks UUID format (RFC 4122) and uniqueness across repository
3. Validates category (exact match: Workshops, Demos, Labs, Sandboxes, Brand_Events)
4. Checks YAML syntax in common.yaml and dev.yaml
5. Validates workload dependencies and collection references
6. Checks infrastructure recommendations (GPU on AWS, multi-user on CNV)
7. Validates authentication configuration (htpasswd or Keycloak)
8. Checks Showroom integration and repository format
9. Validates multi-user configuration and worker scaling formulas
10. Checks best practices (display name length, keywords, owners)
11. Verifies reportingLabels.primaryBU is set
OUTPUTS: What It Produces
✓ Errors (must fix) - Block deployment
✓ Warnings (should fix) - May cause issues
✓ Suggestions (nice to have) - Best practices
✓ Passed checks summary
✓ Overall status (PASSED/FAILED/PASSED WITH WARNINGS)
Comprehensive validation report with fix instructions and next steps
